comment._content: discovery.nationalarchives.gov.uk/SearchUI/Details?uri=D1... Private 514363 Charles E V Bewick, 14th London Regiment (survived the war)

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: Charles Ernest V Bewick birth recorded 4th qr 1898 in Westminster Charles Ernest V Bewick marriage to Annie E Reed recorded 2nd qr 1937 in Hampstead Charles Ernest V Bewick death recorded 3rd qr 1958 age 60 in Pancras If Annie were considerably younger than Charles then it would be worth researching the births recorded at FreeBMD to father Bewick, mother Reed after 1937: (Annie E. Reed is too common a name to date her birth.) Elizabeth A Bewick 2nd qr 1942 mother Reed in Sunderland Margaret Bewick 2nd qr 1943 mother Reed in Durham E. Ellen Bewick 3rd qr 1943 mother Reed in Sunderland John J Bewick 4th qr 1946 mother Reed in Sunderland Robert H Bewick 1st qr 1947 mother Reed in Durham E Ian Bewick 2nd qr 1952 mother Reed in Sunderland Linda Bewick 4th qr 1955 mother Reed in Sunderland Anthony Bewick 3rd qr 1959 mother Reed in Sunderland Sunderland and Durham though would seem unlikely relocations for these Londoners. Maybe this lady is the Annie Bewick who died in Pancras in 1945 age 44 - in which case she is unlikely to have borne children during this marriage. www.freebmd.org.uk

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: Christening names Charles Ernest Victor Bewick - same names for 1958 Probate British Phone Books use this form C. E. Victor Bewick www.ancestry.co.uk
